message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, especially the elevated ESR, suggest temporal arteritis as the most likely diagnosis. Oral prednisone is the treatment of choice for temporal arteritis, and should be started immediately to prevent blindness from involvement of the ophthalmic artery. CT head without contrast and temporal artery biopsy are not indicated at this point in diagnosis and management. IV methylprednisolone is reserved for severe presentations or patients who are unable to take oral medications.
